title: Smurfs are getting out of control.
body:
Before i preface this, no the whole probability thing does not matter here so just listen before you start spouting some math bullshit.

In the last week i have played around 50 games.

In those 50 games i have been up against a gold smurf duo 10 times.

And a full premade of smurfs twice.

If i had not had those 12 unwinnable games id have a winrate of about 74% or around there for the entire week, instead its 50%

These cunts are not here boosting friends.

They arent even trolling.

They are coming into these bronze games, destroying them and going 15/0 and shit like that, bragging about their score and going out of their way to tilt the enemy.

And then they just keep queueing.

And they do it for multiple hours a night (i know since i have alot of them added to atleast attempt to avoid their queues, which doesnt always work since sometimes they wait for me to queue)

The sadistic fucks honestly give zero shits about the people around them in that elo, all they care about is having a few hours of fun dumpstering on what is effectively helpless people who cant defend themselves.

I know riot likes to take a neutral stance on smurfing but holy fuck riot this is going too far.

When around 25% of my fucking games are comprised of smurfs how can that be acceptable.

Like no fucking wonder the mmr system is so fucking inaccurate.

And before some of you are like "well maybe you/your premade is just bad"

No the people i play with were silver last season and i myself was b1 (not on this account) we are playing at b5 elo.

When im not against smurfs we dumpster the enemy teams so hard that its not even fun.

We can tell when someones smurfing because of that one fact.

That and the people ive added have shown me their mains.

Now you can bitch and moan and be like "well just deal with it" if im getting smurfs in a fucking quarter of my games.

Think about everyone else in my elo, if im dumpstering people in this elo, and these smurfs are dumpstering me, then everyone doesnt stand a fucking chance at all.

and you can argue "well they will just climb out eventually" no because i can confirm, they will throw games on purpose to drop mmr to stay at their smurf elo, because i was in those games aswell.

You want to argue that there isnt an elo hell.

Elo hell isnt where you cant climb.

Elo hell is where you cant improve because you are just that much better than your elo so you dont have anyone good to challenge you.

But you are also in the smurf zone where they are so much better than you that you dont even have a chance to improve because you are too busy tearing your hair out.

Fix this shit riot, make it fucking reportable, and follow up on the fucking reports.

Its killing the fucking game.

replies.body:
Well I just want to address the fact that they tilt you, it is obviously banter and even if it's not you can mute them. If I'm bronze it is still possible to beat golds, it's plat where it's "annoying".

I agree that smurfs are too common but it's because high elo is hard to go anywhere with especially with queue times. Personally I think smurfs are a good thing because I can observe what they do and learn from them without having to pay for a boost or get dynamic boosted or something.

Tbh i would enjoy learning from them too but its not like "oh they are beating me from X mistake i just wont do that next time"

its more like "oh fuck i cant get near my cs because their mechanical skill is far beyond mine and their smurfing lee sin is camping me because they are duoed so ill stay under tower and wait, oh fuck they are freezing lane, oh fuck the lee sin just insec'd me"

You dont learn from that, all you learn is that when you have high mechanical skill and team work that shit like that works.
You can learn their mechanical skill by watching stuff they do.

Thats not how you learn mechanics.

You learn mechanics by practicing the combos and improving reflexes.

I know this because im a mastery 7 akali main who constantly has to improve my combo times.

Im at the point atm that in about 0.5 seconds i can q ult auto e ignite and gunblade you.

You dont learn to do that shit by watching someone do it.

You might be able to learn the combos used, but you can just google that shit and its usually common knowledge.

like in my case akali everyone knows that in the early game the combo is to q wait for 1s left on cd then ult auto q again auto again e, its just common knowledge, and you certainly wouldnt learn to do that by watching another akali player because you cant see their cooldowns
Its a known fact that playing (anything) with people who are better than you, makes you better yourself.

You do learn mechanics that way. I can make up combos or practice speed and improve myself too. I never said it is the ONLY way to get better, but watching better people or playing AGAINST better people makes you a better player if you choose to observe, don't try to argue against that.

I said you can learn from smurfs, by observing their decisions and mechanics. Sure you can practice Akali and even innovate, but you can also play against or spectate even better Akalis to learn.

I was exaggerating a bit when I said smurfs are a good thing, I think I meant that smurfs CAN be beneficial to the enemy, even if overall it is a negative thing.

Ok rengo ill give you a scenario.

lets say a ryze walks into your team and uses a combo like qeqwqeq

aka the machine gun combo.

That you while actively focusing on your own play are going to have the time to process what his inputs were even though he just casted 7 skills in the span of one second, not counting any summoners or items used.

And learn to use that combo?

I can agree with watching another play AFTER The fact, like say watching better players on youtube.

But you cant just watch and learn combos like that inside your game as you only have incomplete information.

Ill agree that you can learn things like how to proxy by watching a singed.

But that isnt mechanics, thats tactics.

Mechanics is just that, mechanics, its information you cant learn by watching because its basically muscle memory.

For instance you dont learn to last hit by watching another player last hit.

You learn to last hit by practicing last hitting.

You can learn to freeze a lane by watching another player freeze a lane but thats not mechanical skill thats game knowledge.

Fair point, that's Ryze. But you act as if I didn't say decisions / game knowledge in my original point. I quote "I can observe what they do and learn from them". This includes maybe Ryze ulting in for a different use, pushing a different lane than you would think, performing more complex strategies which you don't find out until after the fact.

And if they were an innovator, they would make up a new combo that you find out about.

However, as the guy below said not all smurfs are going to tryhard their way back to high elo. Some might "troll" as in still win but not really put in 100% which they don't need to.

So that makes that kind of smurf really bad but I do believe you can learn from a try hard smurf because you can. Doesn't make it good, people have problems in high elo which causes them to smurf such as boring game play, in-passable divisions, long queue times and more.

As I said, if you observe what they do you will learn. If you play against better players you naturally get better, but if you actually observe what they do then yes you will learn specific things. No incomplete information.

That's assuming it's a competitive game which if you play against smurfs enough you will understand their is a reason why they are higher elo and the games aren't competitive. I agree with Yellowbrickroad and I have had smurfs a lot lately too. The last one I played we were very very lucky enough to win even though the adc was 3 hitting us at 2 items. So from that aspect, yes sometimes if you stay positive and all the planets happen to align you can get up and win but unlikely in my experience.
Furthermore, if you're on you're smurf, the whole reason you're doing it in the first place is to troll and stomp some kids much lower than you, get you're confidence up and get a free win. That's not rocket science and they can be as arrogant and rude as they want because the chances they will get punished is very low.

Half the problem is that RIOT perma-bans people so easily and often without warning, so when a high elo player gates banned, they work themselves back up again through our elo on a new account.


And seriously... I highly doubt the high elo players on your friends list WAIT for you to queue...

I queue they immediately queue up.

I unqueue, they unqueue.

Coincidence?

Also i should also restate that i am playing at b5 elo.

The standard elo is silver 3 when you are doing your first placements on your account.

The only way to get placed b5 is to have been in bronze last season before the mmr reset (the way i managed to end up in b5) or purposefully lose all your placements.

The reason i say purposefully is because even at my worst a few seasons ago the lowest rank i managed to achieve in placements was b3 so i honestly cant comprehend how someone can be so bad at the game to actually place b5 on a fresh account (keyword fresh, as i said mmr reset while in bronze basically fucks you up the ass for placements)

In other words, if you are smurfing in my elo you aint ranking up a fresh account, you are here on purpose.

Both myself and a friend play at Silver level, even higher in normals (I'm assuming so as we frequently get matched with golds and above)

and both of us were placed in bronze 5 and couldn't get out for a long long time.

Bronze 5 is one of the hardest elo's and even really good players can struggle to get out once in there.

Ill agree with you there.

I cant say exactly what trait of b5 causes it to be such a pain to climb out of, but if i had to guess it would be the chaotic nature of it.

In my experience in bronze the game legitemately gets easier as you go up in ranking up to about high end b2, from there the game slightly gets harder, not as hard as b5 to climb but the players there are of a significantly better skill so unless you are well below your true mmr your games turn from pubstomps that get thrown by bad team decisions to more even games.

Thats in my own personal experience (ive gotten to b1 on every account ive played in every season ive played bar this one, thanks dynamic queue haha)

Think about what you're saying; people who are a much higher elo than you, who you just happened to add as a friend after playing with them once, now devote their entire playtime to ensure they can get into the same game as you?

Your sense of self importance must be unreal for you to think that.

Being pedantic doesnt change fact.

When they notice i am online they will actively unqueue if i unqueue.

are you saying that what i see with my own eyes while watching their game status is false?

They are fucking trolls mate and they realised that im an easily tilted player who will react when they troll, they do it because im an easy target.

Not because the sun shines out my ass.
Can confirm. We usually wait for op to queue just to troll him.

Yet another smurf pre-made game!
20 minute ff 5 kills to 35
3-7 jax       s5               7-5 yas          b2
1-8 volly    b2               7-0 yi             s5
0-7 morg  unranked    2-1-20 trun   s2
1-5 luc      s2                5-1 cait         b3
0-8 akal    unranked   14-0 zed        s5     19k dam done! 2 items

1-2 games out 30 this will be the result if I solo q. If this happens even once in challenger or in a tournament imagine the uproar. 
This is the system we entrust Riot with our loyalty and our money.
Gimme smurfs. Me Gargamel.

People who do well aren't always smurfs but are just having a spicy game. I do believe there are more smurfs then ever because of the long queue times at higher elo. 

That being said you have the chance to play against higher skilled players so it's not all bad. If you have a great team comp you should be able to out carry one person as a team. I know that team work doesn't always come easily but finding a duo/trio will help a lot.

Its not one smurf its smurf premades.

And like i said i can tell when its a smurf compared to when its just someone playing well or someone like myself whos a few tiers below his true mmr.

Theres a huge noticeable difference between the two in the way they play.
